sent1: The Supreme Court 's census decision matters deeply : a citizenship question could skew counts , affecting congressional representation for ten years , despite Congress 's constitutional redistricting authority .
sent2: The Supreme Court 's decision in the census case is one of the most important decisions it will make this term , and not just because of the importance of an accurate count . As Justice Sonia Sotomayor noted during oral argument last month , the Constitution makes clear that Congress is in charge of redistricting . So if the administration succeeds in rigging the census count — by adding a citizenship question to discourage noncitizens from participating — it could affect how many congressional seats each state gets for the next decade .

sent1: Yankees lost 2-0 to Orioles in final 1964 game ; Mantle and Maris struck out multiple times . Palmer , 19 , pitched first MLB shutout . Orioles outscored Yankees 30-3 in series .
sent2: The final game of the 1964 season for the Yankees would be a 2-0 loss to the Orioles , who had already clinched their first pennant in eight years . It was a day of strikeouts for New York : Mickey Mantle struck out four times , and Roger Maris twice . Baltimore’s Jim Palmer pitched his first major league shutout at age 19 ; he was to win 268 more before retiring with 3,759 career strikeouts . The Yankees were outscored by the O’s 30-3 during the three - game series in Baltimore .

sent1: Pee - wee Herman , Robert Gober , Thomas Eakins , and others curated extraordinary private collections , building personal museums beyond mere accumulation , as explored in Mark Doty’s upcoming book .

sent1: Scotty Scott cherished childhood visits to his grandmother’s Birmingham home , loving her golden , crispy fried chicken and spiced white gravy made from pan drippings .
sent2: When Scotty Scott of Birmingham , Alabama 's Golden Rule Barbecue was a boy growing up in the ' 60s and ' 70s , he loved visiting his grandmother 's house . " She had a great big yard where we could play , " he recalls , " and she made some of the best fried chicken I 've ever tasted . " The chicken was fried in lard until it was golden brown and crispy on the outside but still juicy on the inside . Then it was served with a spiced - up version of white gravy made from the pan drippings and flour . " It was the best ! " says Scott .

sent1: Former fashion stylist , worked for i - D , Elle UK , Nike , Levi’s , Adidas , Diesel . Moved to Berlin in 2015 , went freelance , embraced upcycling , shared work on Instagram , gained popularity , launched own label .
sent2: For many years , I was a professional fashion stylist . I have worked for magazines like i - D and Elle UK , as well as brands such as Nike , Levi’s , Adidas , and Diesel . In 2015 , I decided to change my life by moving to Berlin . I quit my job and went freelance . This meant that I had the time to start experimenting with upcycling clothes . I had been doing this in my spare time for a while already , but now I could take it seriously . I started sharing pictures of my projects on Instagram and people really liked them ! That’s how I came up with the idea to launch my own label .

sent1: Africa’s youth population is booming , with half under 19 and fertility at 4.7 . This demographic dividend offers huge economic potential , but only if youth secure employment .
sent2: Africa has the youngest population in the world , and it’s growing fast . By 2055 , the continent’s youth population ( aged 15-24 ) , is expected to be more than double the 2015 total of 226 million . But it is not just Africa’s youth that is growing . In fact , half of Africa’s current population is under the age of 19 . And with a fertility rate of around 4.7 births per woman , this fast - growing demographic boom shows no signs of slowing down . This means the potential dividend for the continent is huge . Young people are the foundation for future economic growth . She’s right : It’s an enigmatic , unclassifiable art object that includes both fiction and nonfiction and ranges in tone from playful to bleak . Tamaki , a Canadian cartoonist who has won two Eisner awards for her work on " SuperMutant Magic Academy” and " This One Summer , ” among others , is known for her keen eye for detail and her ability to capture emotion through subtle gestures and facial expressions . sent1: UN - inspected trucks carry aid to Palestinian - controlled warehouses , but Israel limits daily entries—down to 15 by Jan 14—causing severe shortages of sugar , flour , and other essentials .
sent2: The trucks carrying the goods are inspected by the UN . They are then supposed to be transferred to a warehouse controlled by the Palestinian Authority . But this process has been slowed down because Israel is not allowing enough trucks into the Strip each day for the aid agencies to keep up with demand . The number of trucks allowed in was reduced from 123 on December 17th to 60 on December 21st . By January 14th only 15 trucks were allowed in per day . This has led to shortages of many basic items such as sugar and flour .

sent1: Kiev residents finally sleep soundly as military convoys fade and freight trains replace them , carrying reinforcements east amid shifting war fronts .
sent2: For month after month , Ukrainian residents of Kiev had been kept awake at night by the clamor and clatter of armored vehicles rolling through the streets . But in recent weeks , as the war has moved westward toward the rebel - held cities of Donetsk and Luhansk , those noisy military convoys have been replaced by the rumble and screech of freight trains chugging east with reinforcements for the front lines . As a result , many Kievans are enjoying uninterrupted slumber for the first time since the conflict began .

sent1: Hayao Miyazaki , a legendary filmmaker , created unforgettable characters . His final film , * The Wind Rises * , tells the true story of Jiro Horikoshi , a dreamer who built beautiful planes , only to mourn their use in war .
sent2: Few filmmakers can claim to have been as influential and universally adored as Hayao Miyazaki . The Japanese animation legend has created a number of unforgettable characters in his films , from Ponyo to Kiki . But it is his most recent creation that may well be his most memorable : Jiro Horikoshi , the main character of his final feature film , The Wind Rises . Based on a true story , the movie focuses on Jiro , who dreamt of building beautiful planes for the Japanese government . He was successful in doing so , but was heartbroken when he realized that his creations would be used for war instead of peaceful purposes .

sent1: Mozart’s * The Magic Flute * evolved amid cultural appropriation , rooted in Enlightenment Freemasonry , exploring Tamino’s quest for self - knowledge and truth .
sent2: The evolution of Mozart’s opera The Magic Flute from its premiere in 1791 to the present day is a study in cultural appropriation , and it would be impossible to discuss the current production at the Metropolitan Opera without addressing that . The original libretto by Emanuel Schikaneder was filled with references to Freemasonry and other secret societies that were popular among the Viennese elite during the Enlightenment period . Its plot centers on Tamino , an initiate in search of knowledge about himself and the world around him .

The show explores what it means to be a young woman in America today .
